newsitem.title: JAPAN: TOKYO STOCKS SEEN HOVERING IN NARROW RANGE.
newsitem.headline: TOKYO STOCKS SEEN HOVERING IN NARROW RANGE.

text.p: Tokyo stocks are expected to move in a relatively narrow range on Wednesday amid an absence of aggressive buyers or sellers, brokers said.
On Tuesday, the Nikkei 225 average finished 274.93 points or 1.46 percent higher at 19,099.11. Its September futures gained 320 points to 19,100.
"Stock prices will be capped by profit-taking," said a broker at a major Japanese brokerage.
But another broker said many participants will likely go bargain-hunting if the Nikkei 225 index falls below the 19,000 level.
Brokers also said market sentiment will be generally cautious after a decline in New York stocks overnight. Buyers will bargain-hunt some international blue chips, they said.
Market players are also watching Nomura Securities Co Ltd's moves after the expiry of some of the penalties imposed for an illegal payoff scandal, they said.
Japan's biggest brokerage was banned from conducting stock-related business at its headquarters and all of its branches until Tuesday.
Market sources predicted trade would stay in a 18,850 to 19,250 range in the Nikkei 225 average.
